clinical_study.brief_title: Proton Radiation Therapy for Pituitary Adenoma
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcomes Study of Proton Radiation Therapy for Pituitary Adenoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect information from medical records to see what effects proton beam radiation has on pituitary tumors and analyze possible side effects.

detailed_description.textblock: Data collection will be obtained from the patient's medical records including initial evaluation, pathology report, dosimetry information, radiotherapy completion records and follow-up.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Due to slow enrollment and feasibility issues.

primary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze outcome data on tumor control.
primary_outcome.time_frame: When each patient has been followed for a minimum or 12 months and then again after 24 months to a maximum of 10 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze outcome data on normal tissue morbidity.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When each patient has been followed for a minimum of 12 months and then again after 24 months to a maximum of 10 years.

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated at a radiation oncology clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically proven pituitary adenoma.
- Age 18 years or older.
- Status post biopsy, gross total resection (from initial surgery for recurrent disease) or subtotal resection.
- Good to moderate neurological function status
Exclusion Criteria:
*Previous radiation that would compromise the ability to deliver the prescribed treatment.
